intro: Glossorhyncha myrtillus, commonly known as the blueberry shrub, is a species of flowering plant in the Ericaceae family. It is native to North America and thrives in acidic, well-drained soils. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically pink or white in color. Its fruit, a small blueberry-like berry, is edible and commonly consumed fresh or processed. Glossorhyncha myrtillus plays an important ecological role by providing food for various wildlife species.
